isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Engine Oil Check

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To check engine oil level and quality and determine if oil pressure is correct for the injection control pressure system.

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

step1.para: Check oil level with oil level gauge. If the oil level is not at full, the fuel injectors will not work correctly.

note.para: If the oil level is above full, the engine has been incorrectly serviced, or fuel is diluting the oil. Check oil for fuel odor.

step1.para: Inspect oil for color and odor. Milky white oil and an ethylene glycol odor indicate coolant contamination.

Check engine service records for correct oil grade and viscosity for ambient operating temperatures. See lube oil chart in the engine operator's manual for the correct grade of oil for vehicle operation in various temperature ranges.

note.para: Do not use 15W-40 motor oil below 20°F (-6.7°C). Long oil drain intervals can cause increased oil viscosity; thicker oil will make engine cranking and starting more difficult below freezing temperatures

item.para: Oil level low: Oil leak, oil consumption, incorrect servicing.
Oil level high: Incorrect servicing, fuel dilution from lift pump.
Oil contamination with coolant: Oil cooler, head gasket, porosity, (accessories i.e. water cooled air compressors.)
